title: How to Make Elderberry Jelly

steps.headline: Wash the elderberries.
steps.description: Remove any stalks. this can be done using a fork rather than your fingers...

steps.headline: Put the elderberries into the pan.
steps.description: Bring to a boil and then simmer for half an hour. During this time the berries will become a soft pulp.

steps.headline: Mash the berries and continue cooking.
Pour the mashed elderberries into the muslin.
steps.description: Tie the muslin and hang the elderberries over a bowl to allow them to drip. Leave overnight.

steps.headline: The next day, measure the juice in the bowl.
steps.description: For every pint of juice, add 1 pound of sugar.

steps.headline: Boil in the pan (cleaned).
steps.description: Continue to boil until the berries reach setting point. This will take approximately 10 - 15 minutes. Test to see if it is set as per instructions under "Tips".

text: Wash the elderberries. Remove any stalks. this can be done using a fork rather than your fingers... Put the elderberries into the pan. Bring to a boil and then simmer for half an hour. During this time the berries will become a soft pulp. Mash the berries and continue cooking.  Pour the mashed elderberries into the muslin. Tie the muslin and hang the elderberries over a bowl to allow them to drip. Leave overnight. The next day, measure the juice in the bowl. For every pint of juice, add 1 pound of sugar. Boil in the pan (cleaned). Continue to boil until the berries reach setting point. This will take approximately 10 - 15 minutes. Test to see if it is set as per instructions under "Tips". Pour into warm jars. Seal immediately.
